source_sentence: 幻師颰陀神呪經(亦云玄師颰陀所說神呪經)東晉西域三藏竺曇無蘭譯聞如是。
translation: The Dhāraṇī Sutra of Dhāraṇī Bhadra (also called the Dhāraṇī Sutra Spell Spoken by the Profound Master Bhadra) was translated and heard by the Tripiṭaka of the Western Regions of the Eastern Jin Dynasty by Zhu Tanwulan.

source_sentence: 一時佛遊於羅閱祇國竹園中鸚鵡樹間。
translation: One time, the Buddha traveled to the bamboo grove in Rājagṛha among the parrot trees.
At the time, there was a Bhagavān.
He was in the bamboo grove on his way to Rājagṛha.

source_sentence: 適在中間道為毒蛇所齧。
translation: Right in the middle of the road, he was bitten by a viper.
He was also haunted by a spirit.
He was also seen by a thief and robbed.

source_sentence: 佛見爾時便往到是比丘所時。
translation: When the Buddha saw this, he went to that monk.
The magician Bhadrapāla accompanied the Buddha there.
The magician Bhadrapāla then said to the Buddha.
"I have a spell that's very large and marvelous.
Now, I want to do a spell.'
The Buddha said, "Stop, Bhadra!
'What you've said mustn't cause any harm.'
Bhadrapāla said to the Buddha.
"In a future life.

source_sentence: 當國國相攻伐賊賊更相劫。
translation: In some future land, nations will attack each other, and thieves will plunder each other.
Those who hate each other will [again] take another eon.
Ghosts and spirits will also plunder each other again.
Poison and venom will harm each other even more.

source_sentence: 若有比丘在山中樹下坐。
translation: Suppose there's a monk sitting under a tree in the mountains.
If he puts on the five patch robe and sits on bare ground, then the four groups of disciples will make sure there's no one left.

source_sentence: 四輩弟子當令無有能嬈害者。
translation: The four groups of disciples will make sure that there's no one who can harm them.

source_sentence: 皆令安隱當令無有病痛如是。
translation: They'll all be made comfortable, and there will be no illness or pain.'

source_sentence: 僧莎梨嗪呢　欝遮梨　首黎　首黎　拔提珊提波陀尼　阿裴耶　達予　乙致[革*氐]闍耶兮拔蹄樓[仁-二+師]陀僧莎傺韉　散提波陀尼曼陀羅睺那　比闍睺那如是祝　斷口語斷諸術斷諸病痛。
translation: Saṃsārizinya, Ucārya, Śrī, Śrī, Bhadisandhipadāni, āpeya, Dayo, Etsī [gṛdhi]jaya, Bhadiru [rin-ji+shi], Saṃsāṃsaka, Bhadrapadāni, Māndārahuṇa, and Vijayanta thus wish to stop speaking, stop techniques, and stop illness and pain.

source_sentence: 是諸閱叉皆作此術　須摩鬼　摩訶閱叉　瞿沙難摩訶閱叉　梵摩具摩閱叉　因阿羅具摩訶閱叉　阿祇眵摩訶閱叉。
translation: These yakṣas all perform these techniques, such as the sumati demon, the mahāyakṣa, the ghoshana mahāyakṣa, the brahmakṣa mahāyakṣa, the arhat mahāyakṣa, and the agni mahāyakṣa.
These [Aṅgiras] are venerable among demons.
I'm known as the cause for stealing from those who seek after us.
I cause those who want to treat people and those who harm people.
I cause them not to know where they are.
I obstruct the confused eye and make it invisible.
All of them won't be able to get an advantage over me.
At that point, he calls out to them, saying, "Come!

source_sentence: 還持鬼神摩訶還持鬼神來。
translation: "Return to the demon god Mahārāja! Return to the demon god Mahārāja!
"Tuṣita, Mahākauṣṭhila," he says.

source_sentence: 因持兜勒羅摩訶因持兜勒羅來。
translation: Caṇḍhaka-dhūra Mahā Caṇḍhaka-dhūra comes.

source_sentence: 梵摩兜羅摩訶梵摩兜羅來。
translation: "Brahmadhura Mahā Brahmadhura has come.

source_sentence: 因持兜羅摩訶因持兜羅來。
translation: Indra-dhūra-mahā Indra-dhūra comes.

source_sentence: 菩陀兜羅摩訶菩陀兜羅來。
translation: Bodhidhūra Mahābodhūra came.

source_sentence: 閱叉兜羅摩訶閱叉兜羅來。
translation: Yakṣa-tūrā Mahā Yakṣa-tūrā came.

source_sentence: 阿多得兜勒摩訶阿多得兜勒來。
translation: Attainer of the Dhulas, Mahā Attainer of the Dhulas, came.

source_sentence: 首羅瞿沙兜勒摩訶首羅瞿沙兜勒。
translation: Śrāgupta-dhūrā Mahāśrāgupta-dhūrā.

source_sentence: 我字因偷諸怨家相求便者。
translation: "My name is 'cause of stealing.' Those who ask for an advantage from enemies.
I'll rescue them all and cover them up.
They won't see each other.
They're bound by a rope.
They're bound by annihilation.
They're bound by malice ...
bound by the desire for intoxication ...
Bound by thoughts of confusion ...

source_sentence: 但歸命佛一切皆得解脫。
translation: But when they give their lives to the Buddha, they'll all be liberated.

source_sentence: 歸命佛時言南無佛告起作禮而去。
translation: When he gave his life to the Buddha, he said, "Namo Buddha," rose, paid homage, and departed.
Bṛhatphala Bhadrapāla Sutra
